alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 15 at 12:06PM PST until January 17 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY EXPIRED AT NOON PST... * WHAT...A period of stagnant air with light winds is expected. * WHERE...In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area and I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County. In Oregon, South Willamette Valley, Central Willamette Valley, Greater Portland Metro Area and Lower Columbia. * WHEN...Through Noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Air stagnation could result in the development and persistence of poor air quality. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While dense fog has either dissipated or lifted in most areas, there will still be a few lingering patches of locally dense for that persist in the central and northern Willamette Valley through around 2 PM PST.
info.instruction: People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with high levels of air pollution during periods of stagnant air. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley
